result.execSummary:
The defendant Sean R. Andro was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: If probation or extended supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.  Collections may include income assignment.  This applies to all counts and financial obligations.

Obey all of the rules and regulations of supervising probation agent. 
** Pay supervision fees. 
Do not possess or consume alcoholic beverages and do not have alcoholic beverages within the residence. Do not possess or consume controlled substances, except by prescription. No THC. Participate in counseling deemed appropriate by your agent, which may include: alcohol/drug, anger management/DV counseling, psychiatric/psychological, AODA Assessment and follow-through with recommended treatment. 
** Pay all court costs including all applicable surcharges, including the DV surcharge. 
** If unpaid financial obligations remain at discharge or revocation, civil judgment to be entered. 
** Defendant is ordered to submit to a DNA sample & pay the surcharge, notice given to def. in court.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Sean R. Andro

records.addlTxt: Conditions of Probation Imposed by the Judge

Attorney Thomas Binger appeared for the State.  Defendant in custody and appeared by zoom w/ Attorney Caley.  Clerk. M.Burke.   State in victim rights compliance. DE pleads guilty. Court finds DE guilty. Court withholds sentence and places DE on probation for 2 years with conditions concurrent to 22CM612; credit for 2 days served if revoked. DE to pay $100 DV surcharge. DE to submit DNA sample and pay $200 DNA surcharge. DNA notice given to deputy with NODC for 22CM612 to bring back to the DE.

Assistant District Attorney Daniel Bernard Deida appeared for the State.  Defendant appeared in court in person. DE dows not have an attorney. The state is going to talk with the DE to see if they can come to a resolution. STC set to 09/02/22 at 9:30.
Judicial Pretrial - in court on September 7, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Due to congestion in the court calendar the JPTC of 07/27/22 at 10:30 is adjourned to 09/07/22 at 9:00.
Due to the ongoing trial in br 2 the JPTC of 06/17/22 at 8:30 is adjourned with Attorney Bub to 07/27/22 at 10:30.
No disposition. Leave on for next scheduled court activity.

MINUTES:  The Court finds probable cause in this case today.  Plea of Not Guilty entered.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for June 3, 2022 at 02:10 pm.  Judicial Pretrial - in court scheduled for June 17, 2022 at 08:30 am.  $1000  Signature Bond Set w/conditions (see bond event).    jk
